cab.content: / /(THIS DOCUMWT IS THE PROP?RTv OB1 HI3 BRITAMI0 MAJESTY*S GOV?,MAT) .SECRET, Copy No.,CP, 895.CABINET.BOUNDARIES OF THJ" AMENIAN STATE.Copy of letter from sir M. Hankc-y to the President,D i^i^tng" C omrotte e"(Circulated for information with reference to CP.759).2, Whitehall Gardens, London, S.W. 1.18th March, 1920-Sir,I am directed by Mr. Lloyd George to invite your attention to my letter of 28th February enclosing, for the information of the Drafting committee, the decision of the Conference of Ambassadors-dors and Foreign Ministers on February 27th in regard to the delimitation of the boundaries of Armenia.The 3econd ,section of this letter read as follows '--"That the boundary between Armenia and. the Free State of Batum should be determined on the spot by an inter-Allied Commission, the smaller zone being preferred."I am directed to inform you, for the information of the drafting Committee that the Conference of Ambassadors and foreign ministers have decided that the underlined words, namely "thesmaller zone being preferred" should be deleted.I am. Sir,Your obedient Servant,(Sgd.) M.P.A. HANKEY.president,Drafting Committee.
